citation.abstract: The question of when modern birds (Neornithes) first diversified has generated much debate among avian systematists. Fossil evidence generally supports a Tertiary diversification, whereas estimates based on molecular dating favor an earlier diversification in the Cretaceous period. In this study, we used an alternate approach, the inference of historical biogeographic patterns, to test the hypothesis that the initial radiation of the Order Psittaciformes (the parrots and cockatoos) originated on the Gondwana supercontinent during the Cretaceous. We utilized broad taxonomic sampling (representatives of 69 of the 82 extant genera and 8 outgroup taxa) and multilocus molecular character sampling (3,941 bp from mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) genes cytochrome oxidase I and NADH dehydrogenase 2 and nuclear introns of rhodopsin intron 1, tropomyosin alpha-subunit intron 5, and transforming growth factor ss-2) to generate phylogenetic hypotheses for the Psittaciformes. Analyses of the combined character partitions using maximum parsimony, maximum likelihood, and Bayesian criteria produced well-resolved and topologically similar trees in which the New Zealand taxa Strigops and Nestor (Psittacidae) were sister to all other psittaciforms and the cockatoo clade (Cacatuidae) was sister to a clade containing all remaining parrots (Psittacidae). Within this large clade of Psittacidae, some traditionally recognized tribes and subfamilies were monophyletic (e.g., Arini, Psittacini, and Loriinae), whereas several others were polyphyletic (e.g., Cyclopsittacini, Platycercini, Psittaculini, and Psittacinae). Ancestral area reconstructions using our Bayesian phylogenetic hypothesis and current distributions of genera supported the hypothesis of an Australasian origin for the Psittaciformes. Separate analyses of the timing of parrot diversification constructed with both Bayesian relaxed-clock and penalized likelihood approaches showed better agreement between geologic and diversification events in the chronograms based on a Cretaceous dating of the basal split within parrots than the chronograms based on a Tertiary dating of this split, although these data are more equivocal. Taken together, our results support a Cretaceous origin of Psittaciformes in Gondwana after the separation of Africa and the India/Madagascar block with subsequent diversification through both vicariance and dispersal. These well-resolved molecular phylogenies will be of value for comparative studies of behavior, ecology, and life history in parrots.
citation.title: A Multilocus Molecular Phylogeny of the Parrots (Psittaciformes): Support for a Gondwanan Origin during the Cretaceous

wikipedia.title: Psittacidae
wikipedia.summary: The family Psittacidae one of three families of true parrots consists of two subfamilies, the Old World or Afrotropical parrots (Psittacinae) and the New World or Neotropical parrots (Arinae).

wikipedia.title: Kea
wikipedia.summary: The kea (; Nestor notabilis) is a large species of parrot of the superfamily Strigopoidea found in forested and alpine regions of the South Island of New Zealand.

wikipedia.title: Kakapo
wikipedia.summary: The kakapo (Māori: kākāpō, night parrot), Strigops habroptilus (Gray, 1845), also called owl parrot, is a species of large, flightless, nocturnal, ground-dwelling parrot of the super-family Strigopoidea endemic to New Zealand.

wikipedia.title: Nestor (genus)
wikipedia.summary: The genus Nestor is one of two genera of the parrot family Nestoridae. Together with the kakapo in the family Strigopidae, they form the parrot superfamily Strigopoidea.

wikipedia.title: Cockatoo
wikipedia.summary: A cockatoo is any of the 21 species belonging to the bird family Cacatuidae, the only family in the superfamily Cacatuoidea.

wikipedia.title: True parrot
wikipedia.summary: The true parrots are about 350 species of colorful flighted (with a few notable exceptionsgroup=Notes) hookbilled, mostly herbivorous birds forming the superfamily Psittacoidea, one of the three superfamilies in the biological order Psittaciformes (parrots

wikipedia.title: Broad-tailed parrot
wikipedia.summary: A broad-tailed parrot is any of about 35–40 species belonging to the tribe Platycercini.

wikipedia.title: Spix's macaw
wikipedia.summary: Spix's macaw (Cyanopsitta spixii), also known as the little blue macaw, is a macaw native to Brazil.

wikipedia.title: New Zealand kaka
wikipedia.summary: The New Zealand kaka, also known as kākā, (Nestor meridionalis) is a large species of parrot of the superfamily Strigopoidea found in native forests of New Zealand.

wikipedia.title: Neotropical parrot
wikipedia.summary: The Neotropical parrots or New World parrots comprise approximately 150 species in 32 genera found throughout South and Central America, Mexico and the Caribbean islands, and two species (one extinct) formerly inhabited North America.

wikipedia.title: Eos (genus)
wikipedia.summary: Eos is a genus of parrots belonging to the lories and lorikeets tribe of the Psittaculidae family.

wikipedia.title: Guaiabero
wikipedia.summary: The guaiabero (Bolbopsittacus lunulatus) is a species of parrot in the Psittaculidae family, belonging to the monotypic genus Bolbopsittacus and closely related to the lovebirds (Agapornis) and hanging parrots (Loriculus).

wikipedia.title: Brotogeris
wikipedia.summary: Brotogeris is a genus of small parrots endemic to Central and South America. The closest relative is the monk parakeet.

wikipedia.title: New Zealand parrot
wikipedia.summary: The New Zealand parrot superfamily (Strigopoidea) consists of three genera of parrots, Nestor, Strigops and the fossil Nelepsittacus.

wikipedia.title: Budgerigar
wikipedia.summary: The budgerigar (Melopsittacus undulatus), also known as common pet parakeet or shell parakeet and informally nicknamed the budgie, is a small, long-tailed, seed-eating parrot.

wikipedia.title: Lories and lorikeets
wikipedia.summary: Lories and lorikeets (tribe Lorini) are small to medium-sized arboreal parrots characterized by their specialized brush-tipped tongues for feeding on nectar of various blossoms and soft fruits, preferably berries.

wikipedia.title: Golden parakeet
wikipedia.summary: The golden parakeet or golden conure, (Guaruba guarouba), is a medium-sized golden-yellow Neotropical parrot native to the Amazon Basin of interior northern Brazil.

wikipedia.title: Red-tailed black cockatoo
wikipedia.summary: The red-tailed black cockatoo (Calyptorhynchus banksii) also known as Banksian- or Banks' black cockatoo, is a large black cockatoo native to Australia.

wikipedia.title: List of parrots
wikipedia.summary: The Psittaciformes comprise three main lineages: Strigopoidea, Psittacoidea and Cacatuoidea.

wikipedia.title: List of parrots
wikipedia.summary: The Psittaciformes comprise three main lineages: Strigopoidea, Psittacoidea and Cacatuoidea.

wikipedia.title: Māoripapegojor
wikipedia.summary: Moripapegojor (Strigopidae) r en familj med papegojfglar som bestr av de tv slktena Nestor och Strigops.

wikipedia.title: Eos (släkte)
wikipedia.summary: Eos r ett litet slkte med papegojor i underfamiljen Loriinae som omfattar sex arter som alla r endemiska fr ar i stra Indonesien, de flesta med mycket sm utbredningsomrden.

news.title: Bird-brained and brilliant: Australia's avians are smarter than you think
news.summary: Calling someone a “bird brain” is not usually meant as a compliment. But as research continues to reveal, birds are much smarter than was once thought.
